file_content.text: Lana. We're in the party. Do you read me?
Loud and clear.
We're plugged into Spire security, ready to assist.
Indo = incoming!
My favorite knights!
Welcome to the Grand Festival of Empress Vaylin.
We must be careful. The HoloNet drones are broadcasting this party for all the galaxy to see.
But first we must free the rebels.
Removing those shock collars won't be easy. You have any tricks up your sleeve?
That I do...
Party favors?
Ion charges, to attach to the security relays. Trigger them during Vaylin's big speech.
The blast will disable the collars, leaving my compatriots free to join your attack.
You better hope your friends can fight. I won't risk the mission to dig them out of trouble.
Your people are on their own.
Consider the warning delivered.
I'll keep the party going while you set the charges. Once the task is done, we'll show the empress what we're made of.
We could use this to our advantage. The more viewers we have, the more support the Alliance gains.
Cameras could be useful.
Interplanetary celebrity status is great for funding.
Tell the rebels to keep away from the Horizon Guards. I'll handle the elite forces myself.
Keep the rebels safe.
Right. Avoid the scary ones with lightsabers.
How did you manage to smuggle ion charges into a party?
That's impressive, Indo.
Vaylin wants to make an example of the rebels. We need to free them before it's too late.
An audience for her cruelty.
Good. When I crush the life from Vaylin's body, I want everyone to watch.
They can watch me kill her.
Entire systems will witness your victory.
I'm with you there, my friend.
I have deceptively large pockets.

You will need to use your wits if you're going to infiltrate Vaylin's palace and sabotage the security relays.
Explore the environment, search for clues, and talk to people within the palace. If you need help, use the "Hint" ability.
